    Educational content

    Quantum Computing with Neutral Atoms

    This is a course introducing quantum computing with neutral atoms. Rather than focusing on the basics of quantum computing, a subject well covered in many places, this material targets expert-level thinking for programming many-body quantum systems. Practice and operation is done via the Bloqade platform, with materials covering both the Julia and Python (in development) versions of the package. The content is hosted on GitHub and was developed under my direction by me and colleagues from QuEra Computing. Stay tuned as a virtual book version of this is under development.

    MIT iQuHack

      iQuHack, hosted yearly at MIT, is one of the largest and most successful quantum computing hackaton events in the world. Find here repos with challenge problems I have curated for various issues of this event,
    • 2023
